description: The air connection is an abstract component representing the state of a connection from the ducting system to a filter unit. The connection can be open or closed. The open state represents a state of the ducting system where air can pass through to the filter unit.

schemas.description: Describes whether the air connection is open, i.e., it is in a state in which air can be passed through

contents.name: ConnectionOpen
contents.description: Indicates the connections status (open, closed, or a state in between)

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates that the AirConnection is malfunctioning, i.e., an error occurs in a component that provides functionality for this abstract component; e.g., an error in the ducting system or a valve. True in case of error.

contents.name: Close
contents.description: The Method Close closes or switches some of the valves in the ducting system so that no air may pass through the ducting system to the device

contents.name: Open
contents.description: The Method Open opens or switches all valves of the ducting system so that the air can pass through to the filter device

contents.name: Airflow
contents.description: Value of the air flow sensor

contents.name: GasQuality
contents.description: Value of the gas quality sensor

contents.name: Humidity
contents.description: Value of the humidity sensor

contents.name: Pressure
contents.description: Value of the pressure sensor

contents.name: Temperature
contents.description: Value of the temperature sensor

description: Triggered when the compressed air supply is interrupted
Triggered when the automatic roll filter reaches the end of the filter roll
Sent when the component has an error that may prevent it from operating
Is sent when the safety system is triggered
The WashingAgentDrainMalfunctionAlarmType is triggered when an error occurs on the washing agent drain
The WashingAgentInflowMalfunctionAlarmType event is triggered when an error occurs on the washing agent inflow
Triggered by the cleaning unit when cleaning of the separator is necessary

contents.name: Recommended
contents.description: Reflects the value of the property CleaningRequested of the CleaningUnitType

description: Is sent when the manufacturer wants to inform the operator that the system requires maintenance

contents.name: Requested
contents.description: Reflects the value of the MaintenanceRequested property of the object from which the event originates at the time the event was sent

description: Triggered when the ConnectionOpen variable of the AirConnectionType changes

schemas.description: Describes whether the air connection is open, i.e., it is in a state in which air can be passed through

contents.name: Status
contents.description: Reflects the value of the ConnectionOpen property at the time the event is triggered

description: Triggered when a cleaning cycle is started or stopped

contents.name: Active
contents.description: Reflects the value of the CleaningActive property of the CleaningUnitType at the time the condition was triggered

description: Triggered when the filter aid reservoir is opened or closed

contents.name: Open
contents.description: Reflects the value of the ContainerOpen property of the FilterAidDeviceType at the time the condition was triggered

description: The DischargeSystemType sends this event when the container is installed or removed

contents.name: Installed
contents.description: Reflects the value of the DischargeContainerInstalled property of the DischargeSystemType at the time the event was sent

description: Triggered when the FilterAidDeviceStatus of the FilterAidDeviceType changes

schemas.description: Describes the action performed by the device for filter aid

contents.name: Status
contents.description: Reflects the value of the FilterAidDeviceStatus property at the time the condition was triggered

description: Is sent when the physical maintenance switch is toggled

contents.name: SwitchOn
contents.description: Reflects the value of the MaintenanceRequested property of the object from which the event originates at the time the event was sent

description: The WashingAgentDrainOpenConditionType is triggered when the washing agent drain valve is opened or closed

contents.name: Open
contents.description: Reflects the value of the WashingAgentDrainOpen property of the WetSeparatorType at the time the event was sent

description: Triggered when the washing agent inflow valve is opened or closed

contents.name: Open
contents.description: Reflects the value of the WashingAgentInflowOpen property of the WetSeparatorType at the time the event was sent

description: Triggered when the high voltage unit supply is activated or deactivated

contents.name: Active
contents.description: Reflects the value of the SupplyActive property of the HighVoltageUnitType at the time the event was triggered

description: The CleaningUnitType represents a device for the reduction of filtered materials in separators

contents.name: AutomaticCleaningEnabled
contents.description: If enabled, the cleaning unit may automatically perform the cleaning according to predefined rules when cleaning is necessary. Otherwise, automatic cleaning is blocked.

contents.name: CleaningActive
contents.description: Describes that the unit is currently in a cleaning cycle.

contents.name: CleaningRecommended
contents.description: Indicates that cleaning of the separator is recommended.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates that the cleaning unit is malfunctioning. True in case of error. Malfunctions can be, for example, that the filter cleaning effect is not sufficient.

contents.name: TotalCleaningCycles
contents.description: Count of the number of cleaning cycles carried out by the cleaning system.

contents.name: RequestCleaning
contents.description: The Method RequestCleaning requests cleaning of the unit. The cleaning unit will perform the cleaning as soon as possible.

contents.name: Valve
contents.description: The valves that are part of the cleaning unit.

contents.name: AirConsumption
contents.description: Describes the current consumption of compressed air.

contents.name: CleaningInterval
contents.description: Time between cleaning cycles.

contents.name: FilterCleaningEffect
contents.description: The filter cleaning effect describes the change in state of the separator after the last cleaning cycle has been run through. This can be, for example, a change in the pressure difference before and after the cleaning cycle.

contents.name: ReservoirPressure
contents.description: Describes the pressure of the compressed gas reservoir of the system.

description: Part of the pressure tank of the cleaning unit for triggering a pressure surge into the separator.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates that the cleaning unit valve is malfunctioning. True in case of error. Malfunctions can be, for example, that the valve does not open or close.

contents.name: Open
contents.description: Indicates that the valve is open.

description: Unit for separating particles from a process air stream.

contents.name: CollectorOutput
contents.description: Describes the current flow or the voltage to the collector.

description: The ConsumtionType contains information related to the consumption of a device.

contents.name: LifetimeConsumption
contents.description: Consumption over total machine lifetime. The AnalogUnitType variables InstrumentRange and EURange must not be used.

contents.name: CurrentConsumption
contents.description: The current consumption of the device.

description: Device used to remove collected filter material from the filter unit. The container can be discharged when a certain filling level is reached.

contents.name: DischargeContainerInstalled
contents.description: Indicates that the discharge container is in place.

contents.name: DischargeSystemEnabled
contents.description: If enabled, discharge can be performed. If disabled, discharge cannot take place; for example, because a rotary valve is stopped or a discharge flap is closed.

contents.name: MaintenanceSwitchOn
contents.description: Status of a physical maintenance switch on the discharge system. True when the switch is on.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates whether there is an error with the discharge system. True in case of error. Examples: discharge motor defective, discharge container full, discharge system blocked.

contents.name: AirConsumption
contents.description: Contains information regarding the consumption of compressed air.

contents.name: FillingLevel
contents.description: Filling level of the device.

description: A device for generating negative air pressure.

contents.name: MaintenanceSwitchOn
contents.description: Status of a physical maintenance switch on the fan. True when the switch is on.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates whether there is an error with the fan. True in case of error.

contents.name: PowerConsumption
contents.description: Contains information regarding the energy consumption of the fan.

contents.name: RotationalSpeed
contents.description: Measured rotational speed of the fan.

description: Device for the application of a filter aid.

schemas.description: Describes the action performed by the device for filter aid

contents.name: AutomaticDosingEnabled
contents.description: If enabled, the filter aid device is allowed to perform dosing automatically.

contents.name: CompressedAirSupplyInterrupted
contents.description: Indicates that the air supply is interrupted.

contents.name: ContainerOpen
contents.description: Indicates that the filter aid reservoir is not closed.

contents.name: DosingRequested
contents.description: Indicates that the filter system requests dosing.

contents.name: FilterAidDeviceStatus
contents.description: Describes the action performed by the dosage unit (see FilterAidDeviceStatusEnum).

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates that the filter aid device is malfunctioning. True in case of error. Malfunctions can be, for example, that there is no more filter aid or that there is a malfunction in the subsystems of the filter aid device.

contents.name: ResetFillingLevel
contents.description: The Method ResetFillingLevel resets the filling level of the filter aid reservoir.

contents.name: TriggerDosing
contents.description: The Method TriggerDosing triggers a single additional dosage.

contents.name: AirConsumption
contents.description: Describes the compressed air consumption.

contents.name: DosageAmount
contents.description: The amount of filter aid that is added per cycle.

contents.name: FillingLevel
contents.description: The filling level describes the amount of filter aid in the pre-storage reservoir.

contents.name: PowerConsumption
contents.description: Describes the current power consumption of the filter aid device.

description: Serves the purpose of extracting and filtering process gas; e.g., air. It consists of several filter units and other devices and components.

schemas.description: Describes the possibility of controlling the system externally

contents.name: ControlMode
contents.description: Operating mode that describes whether the system can be controlled externally. Possible values are manual, auto and other.

contents.name: MaintenanceRequested
contents.description: The maintenance request allows the manufacturer to inform the operator that the system requires maintenance. True = maintenance requested by system. False = no maintenance requested.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Malfunction describes that the filter system has a collective fault message. True in case of error.

contents.name: OperationOff
contents.description: The Method OperationOff turns the filter system machine off. As with the OperationOn method, this method should be present under the FilterSystemType if and only if the filter units are considered components of the system rather than individual machines.

contents.name: OperationOn
contents.description: The Method OperationOn turns the filter system machine on. It should only be available on the filter system if the filter units are considered components of the filter system and do not have their own OperationOn and OperationOff methods.

contents.name: Fan
contents.description: All fans used on the server.

contents.name: FilterAidDevice
contents.description: All filter aid devices that are used on the server.

contents.name: FilterUnit
contents.description: All filter units of the system.

contents.name: SafetySystem
contents.description: All safety systems used on the server.

contents.name: TemperatureRegulator
contents.description: All temperature regulators used on the server.

contents.name: AirConsumption
contents.description: Contains information regarding the consumption of compressed air of the filter system.

contents.name: AirIntakeConnection
contents.description: The connection to the ducting system from which the process gas enters the filter system.

contents.name: AirOutletConnection
contents.description: The connection to the ducting system to which the cleaned process gas leaves the filter system.

contents.name: PowerConsumption
contents.description: Contains information regarding the energy consumption of the filter system.

contents.name: PressureLoss
contents.description: Specification of the current total pressure loss of the filter system between the device intake connection on the raw gas side and the device outlet on the clean gas side.

description: Subcomponent of a filter system consisting of other devices and components.

contents.name: MaintenanceRequested
contents.description: The maintenance request allows the manufacturer to inform the operator that the system requires maintenance. True = maintenance requested by system. False = no maintenance requested.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: One or more subsystems of the filter unit have a malfunction. True in case of error.

contents.name: OperationOff
contents.description: The Method OperationOff turns the machine off. As with the OperationOn Method, this method should be present under the filter unit if and only if the filter unit is considered a machine.

contents.name: OperationOn
contents.description: The Method OperationOn turns the machine on. It should only be available on the filter unit if the filter unit is considered a machine, rather than a component of a larger machine. If the filter unit is only a component of a larger machine, the OperationOn Method should be present on the filter system.

contents.name: SetAndActivateAirflowSetpoint
contents.description: The Method SetAirflowSetpoint sets a setpoint for the airflow. The values unit is the same as the one specified in object Airflow. Since setpoints are mutually exclusive, the method also sets the boolean IsActiveSetpoint of the setpoints for pressure and rotational speed to false.

contents.name: SetAndActivatePressureSetpoint
contents.description: The Method SetPressureSetpoint sets a setpoint for the pressure. The values unit is the same as the one specified in object Pressure. Since setpoints are mutually exclusive, the method also sets the boolean IsActiveSetpoint of the setpoints for airflow and rotational speed to false.

contents.name: SetAndActivateRotationalSpeedSetpoint
contents.description: The Method SetRotationalSpeedSetpoint sets a setpoint for the rotational speed. The values unit is the same as the one specified in object RotationalSpeed. Since setpoints are mutually exclusive, the method also sets the boolean IsActiveSetpoint of the setpoints for airflow and pressure to false.

contents.name: CleaningUnit
contents.description: The cleaning units that are part of the filter unit.

contents.name: DischargeSystem
contents.description: The discharge systems that are part of the filter unit.

contents.name: Separator
contents.description: The separators that are part of the filter unit.

contents.name: AirConsumption
contents.description: Contains information regarding the consumption of compressed air of the filter unit.

contents.name: Airflow
contents.description: Setpoint for the airflow that flows through the filter unit.

contents.name: AirIntakeConnection
contents.description: The connection to the ducting system from which the polluted process gas enters the filter unit.

contents.name: AirOutletConnection
contents.description: The connection to the ducting system through which the cleaned process gas leaves the filter unit.

contents.name: PowerConsumption
contents.description: Contains information regarding the energy consumption of the filter unit.

contents.name: Pressure
contents.description: Setpoint for the negative pressure at the filter unit. Describes the setpoint value for the pressure difference of the raw gas side compared to the environment.

contents.name: PressureLoss
contents.description: The specification of the total pressure loss of the filter unit between the device intake connection on the raw gas side and the device outlet on the clean gas side.

contents.name: RotationalSpeed
contents.description: Setpoint for the rotational speed of a 'virtual' fan. This value is a setpoint. In reality, the filter system can have several fans.

description: Unit to produce high voltage to supply to ionizers and collectors.

contents.name: MaintenanceRequested
contents.description: Indicates that maintenance is requested for the high voltage generator.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates that the high voltage generator is malfunctioning (e.g., excess/insufficient voltage, overheating, etc). True in case of error.

contents.name: SupplyActive
contents.description: Indicates that the high-voltage generator is emitting high voltage.

contents.name: CurrentOutput
contents.description: Current output of the high voltage unit.

contents.name: Collector
contents.description: The collectors of the high voltage unit.

contents.name: Ionizer
contents.description: The ionizers of the high voltage unit.

description: Unit for ionizing particles in a process air stream.

contents.name: IonizerOutput
contents.description: Describes the current flow or the voltage to the ionizer.

description: The safety system is a generic component that represents a protective device. Each component in the PAEFS can reference an instance of the safety system via a Uses reference.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates that the safety system is malfunctioning. True in case of error.

contents.name: Triggered
contents.description: Indicates that the safety system has been triggered. If true the safety system has been triggered.

description: Represents a process value whose value is determined by a measuring device

schemas.description: Specifies the type of a sensor

contents.name: SignalForm
contents.description: Specifies whether the sensor is an analog or a digital sensor.

contents.name: Signal
contents.description: Value of the signal. This includes min/max ranges, unit and other meta information. The optional setpoint should be implemented only for SensorSetpointReadType and SensorSetpointWriteType types.

description: This type represents a process value and provides a setpoint for this value. This type provides only read-access to the sepoint.

contents.name: IsActiveSetpoint
contents.description: Indicates that the setpoint is currently active.

description: This type represents a process value and provides a readable and writable setpoint for this value

This is the abstract base type for separators. It contains optional sensor values that are common to all separators. Users may use one of the subtypes provided within this specification or create their own type.

contents.name: FilterMediumOperatingHours
contents.description: The number of hours that the unit has been in operation since the last filter change.

contents.name: FilterMediumState
contents.description: The state of the filter medium; e.g., pressure difference or gas loading.

contents.name: Humidity
contents.description: The current humidity in the separator.

contents.name: Temperature
contents.description: The current temperature in the separator.

description: A separator that is regenerated by rolling up the filter medium.

contents.name: EndOfFilterRoll
contents.description: EndOfFilterRoll is true if the end of the filter roll is reached.

description: A basic mechanical separator.
Separator that uses electrostatics to filter solid or liquid components from the process air.

contents.name: HighVoltageUnit
contents.description: The precipitators high voltage units.

description: Separator that filters solid, liquid, or gaseous components using a liquid medium.

contents.name: WashingAgentDrainMalfunction
contents.description: Indicates whether there is an error with the washing agent drain. True in case of error. Examples: clogging, burst pipe, defective valve.

contents.name: WashingAgentDrainOpen
contents.description: Indicates that the washing agent drain valve is open.

contents.name: WashingAgentInflowMalfunction
contents.description: Indicates whether there is an error with the washing agent inflow. True in case of error. Examples: clogging, burst pipe, defective valve.

contents.name: WashingAgentInflowOpen
contents.description: Indicates that the washing agent inflow valve is open.

description: Device for regulating the temperature of the process gas.

contents.name: Malfunction
contents.description: Indicates whether there is an error with the temperature regulator. True in case of error.

contents.name: PowerConsumption
contents.description: Contains information regarding the energy consumption of the temperature regulator.

contents.name: Temperature
contents.description: Temperature of the process gas.
